intro: Pleiotaxis gombensis, commonly known as the Gombes mountain fern, is a rare and endemic species found in the high-altitude regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped fronds with a serrated margin. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments on rocky outcrops and forest floors. Its spores are dispersed by wind, and it plays a role in maintaining soil stability in its habitat.
